Module com.example.platformerplain
Package com.platformer.escape_beyond.model.entity.block.obstacle

Class ObstacleBlock

java.lang.Object
com.platformer.escape_beyond.model.entity.block.Entity
com.platformer.escape_beyond.model.entity.block.obstacle.ObstacleBlock
public class ObstacleBlock extends Entity
Represents an obstacle block in the game.

This class is part of the implementation of the Factory Design Pattern, providing a way to create and manage obstacle blocks. Obstacle blocks are static entities in the game world that act as barriers or interactive elements the player must navigate around or deal with.

The class extends Entity, inheriting properties like position, dimensions, and image representation, making it versatile for various game scenarios.

  • Constructor Details

    • ObstacleBlock

      public ObstacleBlock(int x, int y, int w, int h, javafx.scene.image.Image image)
      Constructs a new ObstacleBlock instance.

      This constructor initializes the obstacle block with specific position, dimensions, and visual representation. Obstacle blocks are typically used to enhance the challenge or aesthetic of a game level.

      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the obstacle block's position in the game world.
      y - The y-coordinate of the obstacle block's position in the game world.
      w - The width of the obstacle block, defining its size in the horizontal direction.
      h - The height of the obstacle block, defining its size in the vertical direction.
      image - The Image used to visually represent the obstacle block in the game.
